subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かたな}}
Compound of {{compound|ja|sort=かたな|片|t1=one side|tr1=kata|刃|t2=edge|tr2=na}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

subSections.title: Noun
Coordinate terms
subSections.text:
* {{ja-r|脇差|わきざし}} traditional Japanese [[shortsword]] (30cm to 60cm)
* {{ja-r|短刀|たんとう}} traditional Japanese [[knife]] or [[dagger]] (30cm and shorter)
* {{ja-r|大小|だいしょう}}: “big and small”: the ''katana'' and ''wakizashi'' as a [[set]]

subSections.title: Derived terms
Idioms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|とう|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=とう}} {{m|ltc|刀|tr=taw}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|刀|tr=dāo}}.

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|とう|hhira=たう}}

# a [[sword]], a [[katana]]
# a [[scalpel]], such as that used by a [[surgeon]]
# a kind of [[bronze]] or [[copper]] [[money]] in ancient China, shaped a bit like a [[sword]]

subSections.title: Synonyms
Derived terms
subSections.text:
{{der-top}}
'''Terms beginning with {{lang|ja|刀}}:'''
* {{ja-r|刀下|とうか}}: the [[underside]] or [[back]] of a [[blade]]
* {{ja-r|刀架|とうか}}: a [[sword]] [[stand]]
* {{ja-r|刀剣|とうけん}}: a [[sword]] in general, either single- or double-[[blade]]d
* {{ja-r|刀工|とうこう}}: a [[swordsmith]]
* {{ja-r|刀貨|とうせん}}: a kind of [[bronze]] or [[copper]] [[money]] in ancient China, shaped a bit like a [[sword]]
{{der-mid}}
'''Terms ending with {{lang|ja|刀}}:'''
* {{ja-r|斬馬刀|ざんばとう}}: an especially large, curved sword
* {{ja-r|小刀|しょうとう}}: a [[small]] [[knife]], [[short sword]]
* {{ja-r|大刀|だいとう}}: a [[long sword]], a [[katana]]
* {{ja-r|短刀|たんとう}}: a short sword
* {{ja-r|直刀|ちょくとう}}: a straight sword
* {{ja-r|日本刀|にほんとう}}: a [[katana]], a Japanese sword, a long sword with a single-edge
* {{ja-r|木刀|ぼくとう}}: a [[wooden]] [[sword]]
{{der-bottom}}
